WorkItem.Description:
Im looking for help on creating a property sheet shell extension, and i have come across those excellent examples the team has made but unfortunately, none of them does implement the Property sheet, well, im wrong, there is one, in C++, and i believe thats even unmanaged code, im not sure, since basically, i dont know anything about c++
Â 
I would like to request an example on how to create a basic property sheet in VB.net.

Comments.Message: CSShellPropSheetHandler doesnt appear in the later releases either, and the 9/10 release was empty...

Hello

Writing Windows Shell extension in managed code is still not supported, so we removed all .NET 4 managed shell extension samples written in the past. 
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/codefx/archive/2011/01/04/is-it-officially-supported-to-write-windows-shell-extension-using-net-4-today.aspx

I will update this blog and our team will provide the code samples when it becomes officially supported in future. 

Thanks for your understanding

Microsoft All-In-One Code Framework

Ok.  So, 'find' in dsa.msc is shell based, so attribute editor and managed code prop pages dont show up when viewing a user that way.  Perhaps you could point me in the direction of the documentation to extending Active Directory Administrative Center since it is the new 'hot thing' ?
